dt: {bc}a usually amorphous mineral that is a hydrated silica softer and less dense than quartz and typically with definite and often marked iridescent play of colors and is used especially as a gem

et: Latin {it}opalus{/it}, from Greek {it}opallios{/it}, ultimately from Sanskrit {it}upala{/it} stone, jewel
shortdef: a usually amorphous mineral that is a hydrated silica softer and less dense than quartz and typically with definite and often marked iridescent play of colors and is used especially as a gem
